rev.comment: /* Early years */ his father was dead when he "wrote" those words. // links
/* The five-dollar workday */ this is stated just a few sentences back

Some very disingenuous edit summaries in recent weeks. Alleged talk page consensus that does not match the actual consensus; misspellings and dumb hyphenation in the edit; another editor claiming "corrected URL" when rewriting the lede.
Revert to revision 450937818 dated 2011-09-17 08:20:03 by Helpful Pixie Bot using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
Read the books already inline-cited before asking for citations for "sponsor of development".
Revert to revision 451393768 dated 2011-09-19 21:12:51 by JustinTime55 using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* Popular culture */ Fixed errors in Ford: The Man and the Machine; Ironside's appearance not starring
adding info as per talk page consensus
/* The five-dollar workday */ Restoring verbatim quote. Also, "oftentimes" (styled solid) is in fact a dictionary headword (e.g. see Merriam-Webster Collegiate).
/* The five-dollar workday */ typos Couzens, linked
/* The Dearborn Independent */ added quote by von Schirach (translation my own)
/* The Dearborn Independent */ Added quote regarding Himmler's adoration of Ford.
/* The Dearborn Independent */ I felt a link to the publisher was in order.
/* Popular culture */ These two are actually part of the same thing
/* Popular culture */ These two are actually part of the same thing
/* The Dearborn Independent */ another mention to existing reference
Citation 68 specifically says "James Mooney received a similar medal for his 'distinguished service to the Reich'" - other statements requiring citations flagged

/* The Dearborn Independent */ removing probable OR reeking of NPOV: the reference is about GM, not similarity or dissimilarity of different Nazi awards. If you revert, do specify exact page number in the book that claims the 2 medals "similar".
/* The Dearborn Independent */ completed the sentence.
Em and en dashes. Ask if you need explanation—there is one. Thanks.
Undid good-faith rev—explicit subordinating conjunction is better for most EFL readers and machine translators.
Changed protection level of Henry Ford: More standard expiration. ([[WP:TW|TW]]) ([edit=autoconfirmed] (indefinite) [move=autoconfirmed] (indefinite))

Undid revision 439790982 by [[Special:Contributions/Three-quarter-ten|Three-quarter-ten]] ([[User talk:Three-quarter-ten|talk]])sorry. 1st edit to remove opinion, 2nd, whining. does't add information. not a great improvement though, Thanks.

Sounds like something that is probably true. Don't think it should be removed without discussion or edit summary. Thanks. Undid revision 439790157 by [[Special:Contributions/Markmark12|Markmark12]] ([[User talk:Markmark12|talk]])

/* Mental collapse and World War II */ This should not have been scrubbed out. You can't read Sorensen's memoir without duly appreciating this fact. Of course, criticizing the New Deal was a popular pastime for many business owners of that era.
clean up, replaced: in current dollar terms → today (3) using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* The Dearborn Independent */ Adding {{main}} link to [[Dearborn Independent]]
/* Labor unions */ anchor for link target

Reverted to revision 426788295 by Johnsgreat; no consensus for change. using [[WP:TW|TW]]
moved [[Henry Ford the first]] to [[Henry Ford]] over redirect: Moved back to primary topic
moved [[Henry Ford]] to [[Henry Ford the first]]: because there is a second henry ford and he i the first and i think people need to know that
Name due to grandson having same name.
added [[Category:Chief executives in the automobile industry]] .

removing a protection template from a non-protected page ([[User:DumbBOT/Protection|info]])
/* Interest in materials science and engineering */ added link to Soybean Car
/* The Dearborn Independent */ add cite and clarify
/* On the idea that he invented the automobile */ Daimler wasn't a lone genius either, although his work was a much bigger milestone than that of most others.
/* On the idea that he invented the automobile */

Good point, but already quoted in the [[assembly line]] article in the FMC section (q.v.). This section is more general—reader gets meatpacking plus many other influence details by clicking through to [[assembly line]].
/* On the idea that he invented the assembly line */ Ford's inspiration for idea of the assembly line
moved [[Ford, Henry]] to [[Henry Ford]] over redirect: rvv
moved [[Henry Ford]] to [[Ford, Henry]] over redirect: correction
/* The Dearborn Independent */ Fixed incorrect quote marks
Robot - Speedily moving category International Motorsports Hall of Fame to International Motorsports Hall of Fame inductees per [[WP:CFDS|CFDS]].
One more per recent edit summary re click-thru-ability.
/* Memoirs by Ford Motor Company principals */ Improved parameterization. Incorporate postscript (annotation) with postscript parameter.
Improved parameterization to allow {{Harvnb}} jump-down to operate (I believe these parameter names weren't yet available back when I parameterized these refs).
Adding click-thru-ability to the inline cites of Ford & Crowther 1922. Not guaranteed to load in all countries, but in those where it doesn't, it's fail-safe, as the display text is still the same.
Move randon factoid to misc. section
/* The Dearborn Independent */ typo? text indicates this is a Ford publication
Undid revision 402103074 by [[Special:Contributions/Rjensen|Rjensen]] The quote was in the documentary, written by a Pulitzer Prize winner -- take to tp if you have an issue rather than ew
drop quote from a film review in a popular online magazine-- see talk page for scholarly RS coverage
Undid revision 402079938 by [[Special:Contributions/Rjensen|Rjensen]] ([[User talk:Rjensen|talk]]) we have a film and source that say that -- fee free to add alternate view
Ford never said that--it was written by an anonymous editor of the Dearborn Independent (which Ford Motor Company published) see Daniel Nathan book on Black Sox (1995) p 35

/* Career */ Ugh ... sorry for the repetition ... crafted by Freemasonry artisans who work exclusively in the medium of Freemasonry ... this is better. BTW, tinfoil hats in aisle 3. But a ref's a ref.
Restoring the (content with cleaned up presentation of the) edit by [[User:Ryan kutschke]] per the ref that he provided over at "[[Walter Chrysler]]".
/* The five-dollar workday */ add details and citations
Merging the sections "$5 day" and "Labor philosophy" per recent talk page discussion. Upon closer analysis, I find that having 2 separate sections was merely [[WP:CFORK]]ing.
Maybe you're correct, but how about a ref? Undid revision 400388905 by [[Special:Contributions/Ryan kutschke|Ryan kutschke]] ([[User talk:Ryan kutschke|talk]])
added photo of Ford grave-Dwight Burdette
[[Category:Businesspeople in steel]] —he led FMC as it built the Rouge, he and FMC sponsored alloy dev and use, and FMC made and bought more steel than just about anyone else
Undid apparent verisimilitude test - Undid revision 397317571 by [[Special:Contributions/Copie0178|Copie0178]] ([[User talk:Copie0178|talk]])
1 revision from [[:nost:Henry Ford]]: import old edit, see [[User:Graham87/Import]]
/* Death */ added funeral info and reference
[[:en:WP:CLEANER|WikiCleaner]] 0.99 - Repairing link to disambiguation page - [[WP:DPL|(You can help)]]
/* The Dearborn Independent */ not a RS on Hitler
mention Fordism; peace is already there
Historians of Hitler and the Nazis do not emphasize Ford
I don't disagree with the assertion (prev edit) that a mention belongs in the lede. In fact that is true. But not bloating the very first sentence, though. This iteration is better.
/* International business */ Nizhny Novgorod is not a new name for the city - it is its old, original name.
being the progenitor of German Nazi movement is no small feature; it belongs in the lead. Stop covering the truth!
/* International business */ add cite and tweak; drop useless, unsourced details about a signing ceremony
/* World War I era */ added details of war production and citations
/* Politics */ revise; drop peripheral people and useless links
/* World War II era */ add details based on latest major biography, and drop gossip based on popular magazines
/* On the idea that he invented the automobile */ More undisimproving (earlier poor changes)
/* Sidelights */ Per recent talk page clarifications
/* The invention of the automobile */ revise per talk
/* Career */ fix strange use of a semi-colon.
/* Career */ Join together two related sentences which, when split apart, rendered the 'however' rather baffling.
Citations: [189] added: isbn. Tweaked: url, doi. [[User:Rjwilmsi|Rjwilmsi]]
/* Ford Airplane Company */ Stout Metal Airplane Division of the Ford Motor Company ~~~~
expanding the lead a little bit, including his most prominent features as presented later in the article.
/* Honors */ added, important honors received by Ford was not listed in the relevant section
revised first opening sentence - Ford motors and mass production are what he's best known for
minor activities don't make the lede
reverting malicious deletion - Ford was DEFINED by his pacifism, his support for the workers' welfare and his opposition to "international Jewish capitalism"
doesn't make the lede -- he was a capitalist for example
adding to the summary a summation of the facts as demonstrated by the body of the article itself, currently unrepresented in the summary at all.
/* Interest in materials science and engineering */ This was dropped from the lede (appropriately), but I think it's worth keeping in the article body.
/* Model A and Ford's later career */ This was dropped from the lede (appropriately), but I think it's worth keeping in the article body.
Citations: [Pu158]+: ref, postscript. Tweaked: url. Unified citation types. You can [[WP:UCB|use this bot]] yourself! [[WP:DBUG|Report bugs here]].
Dup cats (WP ck err 17) and/or general cleanup using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* See also */ Delete Fordlandia, already linked in text
/* Popular culture */ Add publication years of novels
/* Popular culture */ copy edit - add British novel, recover from history
/* The invention of the assembly line */ Remove OPED language
/* Preserving Americana in museums and villages */ c/e
/* World War II era */ Delete OPED "Ironically" and other extra details
/* World War I era */ Move literature inspiration to another section
/* Early years */ Note father was Anglo-Irish
In Service Cross caption, changed preposition following "bestowed" as it takes "on." Removed "Mr." before "Ford" to conform style.
